Description: Body sherd of Rhodian pottery Vroulia cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black with two incised curving lines which are not quite concentric and which might belong to petals of a lotus flower; exterior glazed black; incised curved line at top of sherd, two incised lines (partly filled with added red) slightly fanning out towards bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs within Kinch's group B without further precision because of the lack of diagnostic features (reserved handle zone or stemmed foot). For possible parallels regarding the interior decoration interpreted as lotus flower petals, see Kinch 1914, 175, fig. 58.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.17) (phase 3)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 163)
